Detailed Description

Class for writing native files.

A utility class used for writing data to the native file formats.

File section IDs:
The file id range 0x0000 - 0x01ff is reserved for DAZ Studio SDK core classes. IDs in this range should never be used by plug-in developers. IDs in the range 0x0200 - 0xfffe may be used freely by plug-in developers. File section IDs only have to be unique for a given type, they do not need to be globally unique. Also, file section IDs are inherited, so the IDs for a given class must not overlap with IDs used by its parent class. This is why the first 512 IDs are reserved for core classes - plug-ins need not worry about the class IDs of parent classes in the core since those IDs will always be in the reserved range. See DAZ Studio Deprecated File I/O for more information.

DZ_NO_ERROR on success, otherwise an error code.

Returns:
The path to the file we're currently writing.
bool DzOutFile::isOpen (  )  const
Returns:
true if the file was opened successfully and is currently open for writing.
DzError DzOutFile::open ( bool  allowPointerWrites  ) 

Called by the framework. Open the file for writing and write header information. If allowPointerWrites is true, pointer definitions will be accumulated and written to file. Otherwise, calling writePointer() results in an error. Pointers cannot be written, for example, to DzStorable files.

Parameters:
allowPointerWrites If true, pointer references can be written out to the file, if false, pointers cannot be saved to the file.
Returns:
DZ_NO_ERROR on success, otherwise an error code.
DzError DzOutFile::startSection ( short  sectionID  ) 

Creates a new section for writing. Returns DZ_ILLEGAL_OPERATION_ERROR if a section is already open for writing.

Parameters:
sectionID The id of the section to start writing
Returns:
DZ_NO_ERROR on success, otherwise an error code.

Writes the file with the given pointer as the first object.

Returns:

DzError DzOutFile::writeCompressedString ( const QString &  val  ) 

Writes a compressed string value to the file. This function converts the given string to a byte array, compresses it, and then writes it to file. This is an efficient way to save long strings and text blocks. For short strings, it is recommened that you use the writeString() function.

Parameters:
val The string to write to the file.
Returns:
DZ_NO_ERROR on success, otherwise an error code.
DzError DzOutFile::writeCompressedStringSection ( short  sectionID,
const QString &  val 
)

Convenience method that writes a section storing a single compressed string type value. This function converts the given string to a byte array, compresses it, and then writes it to file. This is an efficient way to save long strings and text blocks. For short strings, it is recommened that you use the writeStringSection() function.

Parameters:
sectionID The sectionID for the section to create.
val The value to save to the file.
Returns:
DZ_NO_ERROR on success, otherwise an error code.

DzError DzOutFile::writeRot ( const DzQuat &  rot  ) 

Write a rotation. This method actually writes a reduced-resolution representation, but since the quat values are all in the [0,1] range and we renormalize when we read the rotation back in, this should work fine

Parameters:
rot The rotation to write to the file.
Returns:
DZ_NO_ERROR on success, otherwise an error code.
